# AppExtensionPoint.Bind

**Structure**

A property wrapper that binds an app extension to an extension point of a host app.

## Declaration

```swift
@resultBuilder struct Bind
```

## Overview

Apply this property wrapper to a variable that contains an [doc://com.apple.extensionfoundation/documentation/ExtensionFoundation/AppExtensionPoint] type. Use the variable to define the extension point that your app extension supports. An app extension can bind to only one extension point in a host app.

When configuring the [doc://com.apple.extensionfoundation/documentation/ExtensionFoundation/AppExtensionPoint] type for your variable, specify the host app and extension point details using an [doc://com.apple.extensionfoundation/documentation/ExtensionFoundation/AppExtensionPoint/Identifier] type. The following example shows how to create the variable in your app extension, specify the extension point you want, and create the binding:

```
struct MyAppExtension: AppExtension {
    @AppExtensionPoint.Bind
    var extensionPoint: AppExtensionPoint {
        AppExtensionPoint.Identifier("com.example.hostapp”, name “HostAppFeature”)
    }
}
```

To ensure the system discovers your app extension’s bindings, add a user-defined build setting to your app extension target in Xcode. Set the build setting name to `EX_ENABLE_EXTENSION_POINT_GENERATION` and configure it with a value of `YES`. When this setting is present, the compiler places the necessary binding information in your app extension’s `Info.plist` file.

## Annotating a binding

- **buildBlock(_:)**: Passes an identifier to the extension point type.

## Binding to an extension point

- **AppExtensionPoint.Identifier**: The details of an extension point that your app extension supports.

items.description: Passes an identifier to the extension point type.
